citation.article-title: Cloacibacillus evryensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel asaccharolytic, mesophilic, amino-acid-degrading bacterium within the phylum 'Synergistetes', isolated from an anaerobic sludge digester.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Cloacibacillus evryensis sp. nov.
Cloacibacillus evryensis (ev.ry.en.sis. N.L. masc. adj. evryensis pertaining to Evry, the origin of the isolate).
In addition to the properties listed in the genus description, the following properties are observed.
Rod-shaped bacterium, 2.0–3.0×0.8–1.0 μm in size, occurring singly or in pairs; older cells form chains.
Electron microscopy reveals a cell-wall structure typical of Gram-negative bacteria.
Colonies are light brown, small (about 1–2 mm in diameter), transparent and lens-shaped with smooth margins.
Mesophilic, optimum growth temperature is 37 °C and the growth range is 20–50 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6.5–10.0, with optimum at pH 7.0.
Doubling time is 15 h on Casamino acid medium.
Tolerates less than 0.7 % NaCl for growth.
Growth is enhanced by yeast extract.
Ferments histidine, arginine, lysine, serine, BHI, yeast extract and tryptone.
No growth is observed on other amino acids or carbohydrates.
Acetate, butyrate, propionate, valerate, H2 and CO2 are the usual end products of fermentation.
Sensitive to penicillin, ampicillin and kanamycin, but resistant to vancomycin.
Does not grow on non-protein amino acids such as mimosine and 3,4-DHP.
The type strain, strain 158T (=DSM 19522T=JCM 14828T), was isolated from an anaerobic digester of a WWTP in Evry, France.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 55.8 mol%.
